snippet: Michael B. Curry says he experienced the “given-ness of racism” in the church as a young man. He sees a connection between bigotry that blacks faced and the opposition to same-sex marriage.
abstract: Q&A offers excerpts from interview with Michael B Curry, 27th presiding bishop of Episcopal Church, and its first African-American leader; discussion covers Curry's experiences as black priest, church's plan to make racial reconciliation top priority and his stance on gay rights.
lead_paragraph: Michael B. Curry says he experienced the “given-ness of racism” in the church as a young man. He sees a connection between bigotry that blacks faced and the opposition to same-sex marriage.

headline.print_headline: A White Church, a Black Leader, a Focus on Justice
headline.main: Episcopal Church’s First Black Leader, a Gay Marriage Backer, Focuses on Race
